results.title: Alex and the beast within
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O'Brien
results.brief_description: Cities are a hard place, some say they’re filled with sharks. One man haunted by this belief disappears into his fantasy emerging with the realisation that perhaps there are dragons too.

results.title: Penguins off the page
results.creator_credit: Jon Rowdon and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
A plasticine animation in a live action classroom. Today’s biology lesson is about the different types of penguins. The peculiar magic of wildlife comes to the classroom as penguins colonise his desk to bring each of the species of penguins to life. As the lesson progresses the class watches each species appear and play amongst the mess on the teacher’s desk.

results.title: Mantis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
Enter the world of the insects to study a curious form of predatory behaviour. Mantis is a short computer animation utilizing sophisticated 3D techniques to create an immersive entomological environment in which we follow the misadventure of a praying mantis. During the animation the roles of “predator” and “victim” are switched to demonstrate how some animals must kill for survival while humans can kill for blatantly inconsequential reasons. Glenn Tracy is a graduate of the Advanced Diploma of Arts in Electronic Design & Interactive Media, Creative Media Department RMIT, Melbourne, Australia.

results.title: A Collection of interactive work created by students (MAC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
Interactive works of the Graduate Diploma Students of Animation and Interactive Media at RMIT. The titles included are: ‘Haiku Dada’ - Felix Hude; ‘Arlecchino’ - Rosanna Morales; ‘Autograph’ - Mark Lycette; ‘Totally Rediculuos’ - Greg Zaritski; ‘Travels with cod’ - Gwyn Wethereld; ‘The Swear Club’ - Michael Buckley; ‘Equinox’ - Paul Western-Pittard.

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit
results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Including girls: an overview of gender inclusive curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
